original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 315/325 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 315/325 to the US dollar in the spot market Friday against the previous day’s close of 320/325 to dollar, dealers said.
The spot US dollar was offered at 319 and 318 in late morning trade.
A cash deal (same day settlement) went around 315.25 rupees, dealers said.
Sri Lanka’s rupee appreciated from 360/370 to the US dollar two weeks ago after a surrender rule which compelled dollars sales to the central bank, was relaxed and later scrapped altoghether.
However the central bank had previously hiked rates and slowed credit to create conditions where outflows of dollars fell below inflows.
